job.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: Key projects:â¢Â As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for the day-to-day maintenance, operational support, and reliability of Internet-based and in-store systems.â¢Â On an onÂ­going basis, this position will help identify root causes of operational issues and partner with other team members to drive resolution.Daily Responsibilities:â¢Â Provide break/fix, customer support, and communication to product teamsâ¢Â Create and manage Service Level Indicators (SLIs), and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) using New Relic, and Splunkâ¢ Resolve performance bottlenecks using data from monitoring tools, and profiling utilities like dotTrace, dotMemory, and PerfViewâ¢Â Manage configuration of monitoring, and alerting in New Relic, Splunk, and Pager Dutyâ¢Â Implement OS, and application changes as needed using Chef and Jenkinsâ¢Â Create and maintain system, process, and training documentationâ¢ Drive root cause analysis and post-mortem as neededâ¢Â Conduct monthly OS patching and deploy OS, application, and infrastructure changesQualifications:â¢Â 4-6+ years supporting external, customer-facing web services for a large siteâ¢Â 4-6+ years installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Windows-based systems and services using IIS and MSSQLâ¢ 2-3+ years using Chef to manage servers in Windows environmentâ¢Â 2-3+ years using Splunk, New Relic, and Pager Duty in a large, customer-facing environmentâ¢Â 2-3+ years managing VIPs, pools, and members on F5 Big IPâ¢Â Outstanding troubleshooting, attention to detail, written and spoken communication skills.â¢Â Experience defining and using Service Level Indicators (SLIs), and Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
